overview: This subject introduces students to ethical decision-making, with a focus on health. It explores ethical issues in public health and clinical care, in both Australian and global contexts.

Students will be introduced to frameworks for making rigorous ethical decisions in practice, and learn skills for analysing ethical problems across diverse types of health work and in interprofessional groups.
Topics include: vaccination, voluntary assisted dying, pandemic ethics, donor conception, selective reproduction, and resource allocation.
ilo: Describe the process of ethical analysis in practice
Reflectively identify and challenge moral intuitions
Outline key concepts and frameworks in health ethics
Use these concepts and approaches to perform an ethical analysis
generic_skills: Application of theoretical concepts to practical problems
